meanings.definition: To approve or authorize in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will preapprove the field trip next week.
meanings.sent2: Please preapprove your expenses before making any purchases.
meanings.sent3: I preapprove all snacks before movie night to avoid any surprises.
meanings.sent4: The boss decided to preapprove all project proposals to save time.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to preapprove your vacation days with HR in advance.

meanings.definition: To give approval or permission before something is done.
meanings.sent1: The bank manager will preapprove your loan application.
meanings.sent2: Remember to preapprove any changes with your supervisor first.
meanings.sent3: I always preapprove my outfit choices with my best friend.
meanings.sent4: The committee decided to preapprove the budget for the event.
meanings.sent5: It is important to preapprove any major decisions with the team.
